page.title: 10PETERSFIELD MARKET
page.content: There has been a weekly market in Petersfield almost since the town began about 800 years ago. Nowadays there are stalls that sell clothes, food, toys, materials and antiques. There are more food stalls than anything else, and especially fruit and vegetables. The market is held in the Square and at first it was a cattle market, but this stopped in the 1960s. The market is on Wednesdays and Saturdays. It starts at about 8.00 a.m. and goes on till 6.00 p.m. The market sells quite cheap things. The cheapest stall is the 50p stall. It sells a lot of different things all for 50p. Usually on a Saturday there is an ice cream van there. The stalls do good business with all the people coming in from the surrounding villages to do their shopping.
